National League SAN DIEGO PADRES--Recalled INF Gabe Alvarez from Las Vegas of the PCL.
National Basketball Association CHICAGO BULLS--Signed C Brad Miller to an offer sheet for a three-year contract.

National Football League JETS--Signed OT Cornell Green to the practice squad. Terminated the contract of OT Jeff Pilon from the practice squad. NFL--Fined Minnesota Vikings DE Talance Sawyer $7,500 for an illegal hit on Chicago Bears QB Cade McNown on Sept. 3 and Oakland DE Regan Upshaw $7,500 for a late hit on San Diego QB Ryan Leaf on Sept. 3. Suspended Washington Redskins S Mark Carrier for one game for an illegal hit on Carolina Panthers TE Wesley Walls. ARIZONA CARDINALS--Signed DE Simeon Rice. CINCINNATI BENGALS--Signed S-KR Tremain Mack to a one-year contract extension through the 2001 season. MINNESOTA VIKINGS--Signed OT Reginald Nelson to the practice squad.

National Hockey League ISLANDERS--Signed D Roman Hamrlik to a four-year contract. RANGERS--Signed F Johan Witehall. NHL PLAYERS' ASSOCIATION--Announced the retirement of D Dave Ellett. ATLANTA THRASHERS--Agreed to terms with D Andrei Skopintsev. BUFFALO SABRES--Signed F Vladimir Tsyplakov to a one-year contract and D Jason Woolley to a multiyear contract extension. COLORADO AVALANCHE--Signed F Milan Hejduk to a four-year contract. EDMONTON OILERS--Agreed to terms with C Doug Weight on a one-year contract. FLORIDA PANTHERS--Signed LW Josh Olson. MONTREAL CANADIENS--Signed RW Dainius Zubrus to a two-year contract. NASHVILLE PREDATORS--Signed RW Scott Hartnell to a three-year contract.

Major League Soccer TAMPA BAY MUTINY--Named Bill Dunn vice president-corporate partnerships, Blake Cronin sales manager-soccer community, Valerie Lossa and Kate Kowalczyk account executives and Janet Vasquez sales manager-hispanic markets.

ATLANTIC COAST CONFERENCE--Announced the formation of the ACC/SEC Regional Officiating Program. Named John Guthrie head of the program. BARUCH--Named Kenyatta Pious men's assistant basketball coach. CALDWELL--Named Jill Fishchman and John DeSio women's assistant coaches, Robert Kearns assistant baseball coach and Edwin Schieferstein women's assistant soccer coach. CAL POLY-SLO--Promoted Mike LaPlante to associate athletic director for advancement, Chris Baker to assistant athletic director for marketing-promotions, and Jason Sullivan to assistant athletic director for media relations. CHATTANOOGA--Named Don Harris women's sports information officer. CINCINNNATI--Named Keith LeGree men's assistant basketball coach. DAVIDSON--Named Jim Conlon men's and women's swimming and diving coach. DREXEL--Named Jay Oxenberg operations coordinator-recreation. DUQUESNE--Named Jim Curti assistant golf coach. GUILFORD--Named Adam Taylor assistant baseball coach and Rob Woodall assistant athletic trainer. HARTFORD--Named Chris Pompey men's assistant basketball coach. HARTWICK--Named Allison Blixt, women's assistant field hockey coach, Catherine McEnroe, women's assistant soccer coach, and Aileen Gerhardt, women's assistant volleyball coach. LEMOYNE--Named Anthony Staffiere women's assistant basketball coach. MANHATTANVILLE--Named Matthew Bucci sports information director. NEW ENGLAND--Named Leslie Mourmouras men's and women's assistant cross-country coach. RAMAPO--Named Salma Goldstein men's tennis coach and Kathleen Finnegan women's assistant basketball coach. RHODE ISLAND--Named Brad Bustin and Marc Pantazis assitant baseball coaches and Hector Cardona women's soccer coach. ST FRANCIS, PA.--Named Jacob Morton men's assistant basketball coach. ST. JOSEPH'S, PA.--Named Chris Branscome and Jack Ruggero men's assistant soccer coaches. SANTA BARBARA--Named Pam Tanase women's water polo coach. SETON HALL--Named R.J Boergers assistant athletic trainer. SYRACUSE--Named Todd Wyant associate athletic director for student-athlete support services. WAKE FOREST--Named Jennifer Hoppe women's assistant cross-country and track & field coach. WAYNE STATE, MICH.--Named Melvin Foreman men's tennis coach and Mike Horn golf coach.
